p: Our investigation began with blood samples taken at the start of the experiment (day 0) when the children had not yet consumed any milk. Thus, the results of the initial concentrations (day 0) of selenium and vitamin E before beginning milk supplementation show no difference between these components in the blood between the different treatments (selenium, p = 0.983, and vitamin E, p = 0.159) or in any component of the whole blood count ( Table 2) or biochemical metabolites ( Table 4).
